BuildingInfo.Civilopedia: Tamed Pegasi and Griffons can be trained to support military activities. The Austrin was one of the best at doing this, but every druid worth a pinch of salt can train the beasts into marvelous mounts.
BuildingInfo.Strategy: Use the Aerial Stable to support your military expansions.

BuildingInfo.Help: [ICON_BULLET]Reduce population cost for rushing buildings.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_UNHAPPY] in All Cities.
[ICON_BULLET]The Luxury District gives one random Luxury Bonus resources. It also doubles any Bonus Resources in the city, so a Goldmine provides two Gold Bonus Resources instead of one.

BuildingInfo.Civilopedia: The presence of a Grigori Medic in foreign city is often received with mixed feelings. Common people, often neglected by the elite, welcomed the Medic, since the Medic's presence ensured their healthcare. But the clergy were not as hospitable. Their reactions were varied, in accordance with their religious dogma and their nation's political relations with the Grigori. The Order's hierarchy in Bannor and the Ashen Veil's cabals in Sheaim were often in one position in this issue; they expelled the Medic, or worse, persecuted him as heretic. Even the priestesses of Sirona were considering the Medic's presence as nuisance.
